title: Restaurangchef 100% hos O’Learys Lund
description:
**Restaurangchef hos O’Learys Lund**

**Om tjänsten:** Vi söker nu en engagerad och erfaren Restaurangchef som vill ta ledningen för vår verksamhet hos O’Learys Lund. Som Restaurangchef är du ansvarig för att säkerställa att vår restaurang fungerar smidigt och levererar enastående service till våra gäster. Din roll innebär att driva verksamheten både administrativt och operativt, samt att vara en förebild för ditt team och en representant för restaurangen utåt. Rollen innefattar arbete kvällar och helger. Då O´learys Lund är en mindre restaurang förväntas man som restaurangchef arbeta 80% av sin tid i driften under restaurangens öppettider.

**Om dig**: Vi letar efter dig som värderar likabehandling och respekt gentemot både kollegor och gäster. Din passion för mat, service och att skapa minnesvärda gästupplevelser kommer att vara avgörande för din roll hos oss. Vi söker dig som kommer vara stolt medlem i O'Learys-familjen och som strävar efter att upprätthålla en hög standard och kvalitet i allt du gör, både individuellt och som en del av vårt team.


**I arbetsuppgifterna ingår även att**:


* Driva försäljningen mot uppsatta mål och optimera arbetssätt för att nå önskade resultat.
* Leda ett team inom olika områden såsom bar, servering, kök och aktiviteter.
* Skapa en stark teamkultur och atmosfär genom ett bra ledarskap
* Leda personalutbildning och utveckling av medarbetare
* Ansvara för rekrytering, schemaläggning, planering och prognostisering
* Säkerställa löpande underhållsarbete och rapportera till Operations Manager
* Ansvara för att enhetens gemensamma mål följs och leverera en gästupplevelse av högsta kvalitet.

**Önskad erfarenhet och egenskaper:**


* Erfarenhet från restaurangbranschen, önskvärt från O’Learys
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap och personalansvar
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av Caspeco Cloud kassasystem
* Resultatinriktad, lösningsorienterad, flexibel och förmåga att driva arbete självständigt
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och ledarskapsförmågor
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en snabbt föränderlig miljö

**Låter det här som något för** **dig?**

Tveka inte att söka tjänsten redan idag, intervjuer sker löpande. Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta André Söderlindh, Operationsmanager på Andre.Soderlindh@Olearysgroup.com.Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**


* Resultatdrivet bonussystem
* Personlig utveckling
* Möjlig karriärstege
* Kollektivavtal

**Om O’Learys**

O’Learys är mer än bara en restaurang. Det är ett nöjescentrum som utöver kärleken till sport, mat, dryck och god stämning är en mötesplats fylld av aktiviteter och nöjen alla dagar i veckan.

*Vi tror på forskningsbaserade och objektiva utvärderingsmetoder som stöd i arbetet att hitta rätt person till rätt roll. Av den anledningen använder vi Alva Labs assessmentmetoder i våra rekryteringsprocesser för att hjälpa oss identifiera kandidater som med störst sannolikhet att trivas och passa i rollen.*

title: Testare till FMV
description:
**Tog du nyligen examen inom och vill arbeta med test och säkerhet? FMV söker nu en nyexaminerad ingenjör med intresse för test, säkerhet och dokumentation.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv**

  


**Att jobba som testare på FMV**

  

FMV, Försvarets materielverk, är en civil myndighet med specialistkompetens inom teknik, affärer och försvar. Myndigheten har som huvuduppgift att, i nära samarbete med Försvarsmakten, utveckla och anskaffa materiel och tjänster som stärker försvarets operativa förmåga. FMV upphandlar, utvecklar och levererar för att möta behoven inom det svenska försvaret i både freds- och krissituationer. Här arbetar specialister inom teknik, affärer, juridik och projektledning för att säkerställa att Försvarsmakten får rätt utrustning för sina uppdrag.


Materielen testas på FMVs egna provplatser för att säkerställa att den uppfyller tekniska krav, är säker att använda och har rätt prestanda. Detta arbete är avgörande för att Försvarsmakten ska kunna utföra sitt uppdrag på ett effektivt och säkert sätt.


Som testare på FMV kommer du att arbeta i anskaffningsprojekt som fokuserar på IT-säkerhetskrav och IT-arkitektur, och tillsammans med industrin granska deras tekniska lösningar. Dagarna präglas av nära samarbete med industrin och MUST. Du kommer att arbeta med externa system och testa både hårdvara och mjukvara, vilket kräver förståelse för komponenter som switchar, kryptonoder, dioder och skyddsmekanismer.


Rollen kräver självständighet och metodiskt arbete. Dokumentation och metod är en stor del av rollen. Vi söker en teamplayer med integritet, lojalitet, nyfikenhet och driv.

  


Rollen är placerad i Stockholm.

 **Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**

Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos FMV i Stockholm med start omgående. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos FMV samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos FMV.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en ingenjörsutbildning inom data, maskin eller elektronik.
* Har ett intresse för test, förståelse för mjukvara- och hårdvara samt dokumentation.
* Som person är driven, strukturerad med ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande. Du har bred teknisk förståelse och intresse för att arbeta i försvaret.
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i Officepaketet.

*För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara* ***svenska medborgare*** *samt genomgå en* ***säkerhetsprövning****.*

 **Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 **Om Nexer Tech Talent**


*Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* *här**.*

 **Om FMV**  

*Försvarets materielverk upphandlar, utvecklar och levererar materiel och tjänster till det svenska försvaret. Hos FMV samlas specialister inom teknik, affärer, juridik och projektledning. FMVs olika delar blir till helheter och deras engagemang blir till leveranser. Det är så FMV möter det svenska försvarets behov – i fred, kris och krig.* *Läs mer* *här**.*

title: Information Security Engineer
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our mission is to make life in cities that much easier – by taking care of the parking. With the use of technology, we break barriers, helping improve the urban experience. Our aim is to create a scenario where parking supply and driver demand are balanced not due to additional parking spots and fewer cars, but thanks to predictive technology that connects our users to available spots.

 **The Role**


We’re seeking a skilled **Security Engineer** to strengthen our core product applications through advanced security design, code review, testing, and implementation. In this role, you’ll assess current security measures, build custom tools for enhanced controls, and collaborate with product teams to elevate their security expertise.


Key responsibilities include conducting system tests, supporting compliance, and responding quickly to security incidents. You’ll bring strong experience in application security, risk assessment, and cloud infrastructure, along with excellent communication skills to help teams adopt best security practices. If you’re passionate about building resilient, secure products, we want to hear from you!

 **Job Responsibilities:**


* Maintaining a thorough understanding of product and infrastructure security throughout the Product and Technology ecosystem and enabling product teams in secure development and operations of their applications
* Planning, researching, and designing, and developing secure application security capabilities and CI/CD pipelines.
* Developing, reviewing, and collaborating on the configuration of cloud account configuration, network isolation, security groups, access policies, network policies, VPNs, and overall compute platform security, including both host-based and container-based workloads.
* Integrating identity management systems, digital certificates, and secrets management with application workloads.
* Reviewing vulnerabilities with teams and suggesting strategies and tactics for remediation.
* Validating security implementations and participating in remediation and risk acceptance efforts.
* Working with platform and product teams to implement disaster recovery procedures and conducting security breach drills.
* Responding quickly and effectively to all security incidents and providing post-event analyses.
* Guiding the overall security community, cultivating a sense of security awareness, and arranging for continuous education.
* Maintaining and contributing to a growing threat modeling program, and assisting teams continuous improvement in this area.
* Remaining up to date with the latest trends, standards, and products.

**About you:**

* A bachelor's or associate's degree in IT, computer science, or equal experience. Advanced education or training in cloud/application security is preferred.
* 5-10 years or more of experience in application development and security.
* Experience with AWS, including EKS, multi-account setups, GuardDuty, KMS, Config, SSM, CloudFront, Firewall Manager, Shield, Network Firewall, WAF, IAM, CloudTrail, Security Hub, Secrets Manager, Inspector, Global Accelerator, ELB, EC2, Athena
* A strong working knowledge of current application and infrastructure risks, secure application design, and operating systems including experience with various Linux distributions and mobile operating systems (Android and iOS).
* Experience developing solutions with Terraform, Terragrunt, and/or Crossplane.
* Experience implementing DevSecOps pipeline tools such as static application security testing (code scanning, dependency scanning, secret scanning) dynamic application security testing, interactive application security testing, container vulnerability scanning, and infrastructure vulnerability scanning
* Excellent teaching, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of multiple languages including but not limited to Java, Kotlin, JavaScript, NodeJS, Go, C-Sharp, Swift, Python, bash, and SQL

**What We Offer**

* **Flexible ways of working:** combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* **Digital global onboarding:** three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* **Pension, insurances & health reimbursement:** A competitive pension, in combination with the basic package of insurances
* **Proactive health support:** your wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* Mental well-being support via Blue Call
* **Wellness reimbursement:** 5000 SEK/year

title: Systemingenjör inom miljötålighet till Saab Surveillance
description:
**Tog du nyligen examen inom maskinteknik och vill arbeta i miljöer där gränserna för vad som är tekniskt möjligt hela tiden utmanas? Saab Surveillance söker nu en nyexaminerad ingenjör med intresse för krav, prov och försvar.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv**

 **Att jobba som Systemingenjör inom miljötålighet på Saab Surveillance**  

  

Som miljötålighetsingenjör på sektionen Sub System Engineering kommer du att ingå i ett Environmental Engineering team som arbetar med analyser, kravställning, definition av prov och verifiering avseende våra radarprodukters tålighet mot bland annat vibration, stötlast och klimat. Arbetet berör Surface d.v.s. radarprodukter på land såväl som de till sjöss.

  

Som Systemingenjör inom miljötålighet ingår du i ett medelstort team av seniora och kompetenta ingenjörer. Rollen innebär att tydliggöra och specificera krav för Saabs olika system och beskriva hur dessa ska verifieras. Du stödjer konstruktörer på olika nivåer i produktstrukturen genom att förmedla en klar bild av kraven, hur de kan uppfyllas och vilka verifieringsmetoder som ska användas. Dessutom bidrar du med din expertis till den långsiktiga utvecklingen av produkterna.


I arbetet ingår att hantera komplexa system, skapa optimala lösningar, och arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom ditt specialistområde. Du arbetar nära både hårdvaran och verifieringsutrustningen i olika testmiljöer och samarbetar med systemingenjörer, delsystemutvecklare, projektledare, verifieringsansvariga samt ingenjörer inom beräkning och analys. Rollen kräver både praktiskt och teoretiskt arbete, liksom analytiskt dokumentationsarbete, i en organisation där god kommunikation och helhetssyn värderas högt.


Vi söker dig som gillar att arbeta i team och att samarbeta med andra. Du är även trygg i att presentera och förklara tekniska lösningar för omgivningen. Att hantera nya utmaningar ser du som en naturlig del av jobbet och du väljer enkla och effektiva lösningar. Du är öppen för att prova på nya teknikområden och vill utvecklas både personligt och professionellt.


Rollen är placerad i Göteborg.

 **Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**

Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab med start omgående efter godkänd säkerhetsprövning**.** Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saab samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en civil- eller högskoleingenjör inom maskinteknik, mekanik eller mekatronik.
* Har ett intresse för analyser, kravställning, definition av prov och verifiering.
* Som person har positiv inställning, är resultatorienterad och är en utpräglad lagspelare. Du har ett analytiskt förhållningssätt och att du är drivande i ditt arbete, tar eget initiativ och ansvar.
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.

  

* **Meriterande** är att ha erfarenhet av kravnedbrytning, test, verifiering, provning samt mekanikkonstruktion. C-körkort är även meriterande.

*För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara* ***svenska medborgare*** *samt genomgå en* ***säkerhetsprövning****.*

 **Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 **Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* *här**.*

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Engineering Manager - Shape the Future of CCMS with Paligo**

**Ready to Lead the Future** of Content Management?  

At Paligo, we’re not just producing content—we’re **redefining** how the world’s leading companies create, manage, and deliver technical documentation. As a **globally leading** Component Content Management System (CCMS), Paligo is transforming traditional Content Management and the way technical information is crafted, organized, and accessed by major organizations like **Bitdefender**, **Bluetooth**, **Mitsubishi**, the **European Commission**, **Wrike**, **Alteryx**, and many more.


This position is a replacement for our talented Engineering Manager, Metin, who has decided to focus on his greatest passion: **coding**, and will take on a **different role** within the organization.


As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be part of our engineering team at our headquarters in **Solna, Stockholm**, reporting directly to the **VP of Engineering**. Paligo is a **global company** with clients and teams spread across different locations, but our engineering team is primarily based in Solna, where we prioritize **in-office collaboration**. We embrace a **hybrid working model**, allowing for regular in-office meetings while offering flexibility for remote work when needed. However, the heart of our teamwork happens in **Stockholm**.


We’re on a mission to become the **#1 solution** in our industry, and we’re looking for a dynamic Engineering Manager who’s ready to help us **scale to new heights**. If you love **leading top-notch engineering teams**, solving **complex challenges**, and setting **trends** in the world of SaaS, this role is for you!

### **What You’ll Do:**

* **Lead and inspire** a team of engineers to follow best-in-class development practices.

* Partner with the **Product Owner** and stakeholders to launch **stable, high-quality releases** that keep Paligo ahead of the curve.

* Bridge the gap between teams, ensuring **seamless communication** and a united focus on our goals.

* Prioritize **technical** and **customer needs** to keep us laser-focused on delivering **exceptional value**.

* Cultivate a **learning environment** where knowledge is shared, collaboration thrives, and the team grows stronger together.

* Shape the future of your team by developing personalized **growth plans**, setting meaningful goals, and leading engaging 1-1s and dev talks.

* Own the **Scrum process** and guide the team through successful sprints, making every review count.

* **Attract and retain top engineering talent**, keeping Paligo at the forefront of **innovation**.

### **What We’re Looking For:**

* A **visionary leader** who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

* Someone passionate about pushing boundaries and keeping the **customer** at the heart of every decision.

* An **expert communicator** who can seamlessly collaborate across teams and departments.

* A **natural mentor** with a knack for developing and inspiring high-performing teams.

* Experience in **agile software development environments**.

* Background in **improving best practices** and processes across development teams on a continuing basis.

* Bachelor’s or Master's degree in **Computer Science**, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

* **5 years hands-on software development experience**.

* Experience managing both **onsite** and **remote engineers**.


We realize not everyone is going to check all of these boxes and that’s okay; we still would like to hear from you.

### **Why You’ll Love Working at Paligo:**

* You’ll be at the **cutting edge** of SaaS and CCMS innovation, working alongside industry leaders and trendsetters.

* We’re transitioning from a startup to a **scale-up**, and your contributions will shape the future of our company.

* A **customer-first mindset** drives everything we do—so you’ll directly impact the success of our global clients.

* We believe in **open communication**, collaboration, and a fun, healthy work culture that celebrates **diversity** and **inclusion**.

* Our fast-growing, dynamic environment offers **endless opportunities** for growth and development.

* We recently moved into brand new **modern offices** in walking distance of transit and lunch destinations.

* We have great employee perks, including an annual **Wellness contribution**, **Professional Development budget**, **Home office contribution**, and **Parental pay**.

### **Who We Are:**


At Paligo, we’re disrupting the CCMS landscape with our cloud-based platform that helps the world’s biggest brands manage technical, knowledge, and product documentation like never before. Our clients span industries and geographies, but they all have one thing in common: they trust Paligo to deliver the future of content management.

### **Join Us in Making History**


If you’re ready to lead a talented team of engineers and contribute to something truly game-changing, we’d love to hear from you! Curious about our culture and values? Check out our careers page here and get a feel for what it’s like to be part of the Paligo community.

title: Lease Analyst, DCC Communities
description:
* Minimum 5 years of demonstrated experience in contract management or lease administration.
* Experience in office, industrial, commercial, and/or data center real estate.
* Experience managing large projects.
* Experience and competence utilizing commercial real estate software platforms
* BS/BA degree in Accounting, Legal, Finance or related experience as a Lease Analyst.


The AWS Global Data Center Supply Solutions Team is looking for an experienced Analyst based in the either London, Dublin, or Frankfurt. In this role, you will be a key member of the Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) team responsible for tracking and analyzing the operational, financial and contractual performance of our expanding portfolio in Europe, Africa and the Middle East. Analysts work closely with lessors/vendors and internal partner teams to ensure accuracy of our portfolio data points in order to mitigate risks and support portfolio optimization.
  
  

Our Lease Analysts are detail oriented, work independently in an extremely fast-paced environment with a high degree of ambiguity.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Review, audit and process rent in line with internal Spend & Transaction Policies and contractual terms to ensure landlord/vendor adherence
* Responsible for creating and managing weekly, monthly or quarterly vendor and partner reviews
* Maintain positive relationships with internal stakeholders and deliver results requiring collaboration and coordination with multiple teams
* Onboarding and tracking of payment setup for all new landlords/vendors
* Interpret complex commercial contract language related to contractual obligations, SLAs, rent, tax, insurance and maintenance clauses
* Review of contract related documentation and abstraction of critical information.


A day in the life
  
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
  
  

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
  
  

About the team
  
Why AWS
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship and Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

* 5+ years of experience in commercial real estate or lease administration.
* Experience with large, global real estate portfolios.
* Experience with Tango and/or Oracle and/or current accounting standards (GAAP).


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Cloud Infrastructure Engineer – Shape the Future of Our AWS Infrastructure** 




 At Paligo, we’re not just producing content—we’re redefining how the world’s leading companies create, manage, and deliver technical documentation. As a globally leading Component Content Management System (CCMS), Paligo is transforming traditional content management and the way technical information is crafted, organized, and accessed by major organizations like Bitdefender, Bluetooth, Mitsubishi, the European Commission, Wrike, Alteryx, and more.
 



 As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, you’ll join our talented team at Paligo's headquarters in Solna, Stockholm, working alongside other tech leaders to drive the ongoing innovation of our cloud infrastructure. Our cloud team is small but agile, prioritizing collaboration and technical excellence. Here, you’ll have the chance to work closely with our engineering team and make a significant impact on our journey to becoming the #1 CCMS in the industry.
   




**What You’ll Do:** 





 - Design, implement, and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure, ensuring best practices and strategic alignment.
 











 - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive cloud projects from inception to completion.
 











 - Develop pipelines, scripts, and tools to streamline deployment, improve developer experience, and increase operational efficiency.
 











 - Enhance the security, performance, and reliability of AWS cloud services through proactive monitoring and troubleshooting.
 











 - Stay ahead of industry trends, evaluating new AWS services and technologies to improve our cloud environment.
 











 - Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, define architecture, and provide technical expertise.
 






**What We’re Looking For:** 





 - A Cloud Infrastructure Engineer with 5 years’ experience focused on AWS, with certifications like AWS Certified Solutions Architect or AWS Certified DevOps Engineer preferred.
 











 - Solid knowledge of AWS services like ECS, S3, Lambda, SQS, RDS, CloudFormation, and CDK.
 











 - Skilled in Go, Python, TypeScript, and automation tools for cloud provisioning and deployment.
 











 - Expertise in cloud security, identity management, and data encryption.
 











 - Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to guide and coach engineers new to AWS.
 











 - A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong analytical skills.
 







  





**Why You’ll Love Working at Paligo:** 








 - You’ll be part of an industry-leading SaaS and CCMS innovator, helping drive the future of content management.
 











 - A fast-growing, dynamic work environment with endless opportunities for growth.
 











 - Newly upgraded, modern offices near transit and dining options.
 











 - Great perks, including an annual wellness contribution, professional development budget, home office support, and parental pay.
 







  





**Who We Are:** 




 At Paligo, we’re disrupting the CCMS landscape with our cloud-based platform, trusted by major global brands to manage their technical documentation. We value open communication, collaboration, and a vibrant work culture celebrating diversity and inclusion.
 


**Join Us in Shaping the Future of Cloud Infrastructure!** 

 If you’re passionate about AWS and ready to contribute to our mission, we’d love to hear from you! Ready to learn more? Explore our culture and values on our careers page and see what it’s like to be part of the Paligo community.

title: Business Analyst
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented
 **Business Analyst (BA)** 
 with strong User experience flow creation skills to join our team and play a pivotal role in replacing our customer's existing legacy application with a new cloud-based SaaS solution. You will be responsible for gathering business requirements, analysing current processes, creating user journeys through BX flows, and ensuring a smooth transition to the new system. Your experience in testing will also be crucial to identify and resolve any potential issues during implementation.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Collaborate with customer key stakeholders across various departments (operations, finance, commercial, customer service) to understand their needs and requirements for the new SaaS solution
* Analyze the existing legacy application functionalities and identify areas for improvement or automation
* Document and translate business requirements into clear and concise specifications for the SaaS implementation team, including the creation of user journeys through BX flows
* Work collaboratively with the SaaS vendor to ensure the new system meets all defined requirements and aligns with the designed BX flows
* Develop and maintain comprehensive test plans to identify and address any integration or functionality issues during the implementation process
* Create user guides, training materials, and process documentation to facilitate a seamless user transition to the new SaaS platform
* Support user adoption by providing ongoing assistance and addressing any post-implementation questions or concerns


**Requirements**
* Minimum 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst or similar role
* Proven experience in eliciting, documenting, and analyzing business requirements
* Strong understanding of SaaS implementation methodologies and best practices
* Solid experience in creating user journeys and designing BX flows (Blue Experience)
* Experience with user interface (UI) design principles is a plus
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively
* Prior experience in testing methodologies (e.g., black-box testing) is a strong plus
* Experience within the taxi or transportation industry is a plus
* Proven experience in managing business requirements and projects using project management methodologies and tools like Jira, Confluence, Monday, etc
* Familiarity with user story creation, backlog management, and communication tools
* Willingness to learn and adapt to new project management platforms used by the customer


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
* Collaborative and innovative work environment

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Compensation** 
 : Competitive salary + equity
 



  





**Location** 
 : Stockholm (hybrid, 1-2 days in-office per week)
 



  





**Culture** 
 : Inclusive, supportive, strong emphasis on work-life balance
 



 Join a high-growth SaaS company at the forefront of AI Education innovation. With Stockholm as HQ and 300+ staff globally, this company has successful gone through Series B funding and is now looking to scale.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As an Infrastructure Engineer, you’ll work on scaling and optimising cloud environments, using tools like GCP, Terraform, and Kubernetes. This role involves close collaboration with cross-functional teams to ensure secure, resilient, and highly available infrastructure.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure with GCP, Terraform, and Kubernetes
* Automate infrastructure processes for scalability and reliability
* Collaborate with engineering teams to streamline deployment pipelines and improve performance
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimise infrastructure for high availability



  





**Qualifications** 



* Strong experience with GCP, Terraform, and Kubernetes
* Proficiency in cloud infrastructure automation and best practices
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills

title: DevOps Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Looking to revolutionize the intersection of development and operations in a fast paced tech company? Join us in reshaping the technological landscape as a DevOps Engineer. Dive into dynamic challenges, collaborate with top-tier talents, and drive innovation in a supportive, forward-thinking environment. As a DevOps Engineer, you'll dive into exciting challenges and work together with several software teams across the world to provide the best software infrastructure.
   

  

**About Us:**
 At Mycronic we are on the cutting edge of software development, working with one of the most advanced products in the industry. Our collaborative team of experienced developers embraces an open mindset, working together to solve challenges and push the boundaries of what's possible. We foster innovation, encouraging development and exploring new paths to problem-solving. Join us, and you'll be part of a dynamic environment where you're challenged to enhance quality and contribute innovative solutions.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 We are currently seeking a skilled DevOps Infrastructure Engineer to serve as an admin and power user for our suite of infrastructure tools, including but not limited to Gitlab, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Docker, WMWare, Cloud Azure, and Black Duck. As an expert in these tools, you will play a crucial role in supporting the software lifecycle, from development to deployment. This position requires programming knowledge to work with and maintain these tools, along with the ability to develop new tools and scripts for automation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Administer and manage infrastructure tools such as Gitlab, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Docker, WMWare, Cloud Azure, and Black Duck.
* Support the software lifecycle from development to deployment.
* Develop and maintain scripts and tools for automation.
* Work independently and take ownership of projects.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure operational efficiency.
* Test and evaluate new tools and methods for effective software development.
* Provide support for infrastructure observability.
* Promote automated software testing and continuous integration.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to producing high-quality software solutions.
* Adaptable and open to learning new technologies and tools.
* Strong communication skills for effective collaboration with teams, developers, and stakeholders.
* Enjoy sharing knowledge and supporting team members.


**Experience:**
* At least 3-10 years of relevant work experience.
* Experience working in an Agile environment.
* Administration of Linux environments in a corporate setting.
* Containerization technologies and orchestration experience.
* Strong scripting skills in Python and Bash.
* Infrastructure as code experience.
* Administration of code repository and continuous integration servers.
* Familiarity with system architectures, basic network, and storage experience.
* Familiarity with Azure Tenant administration.
* Familiarity with software composition analysis and license compliance.


**Mandatory Knowledge:**
* Gitlab
* Python
* Bash
* Debian/Ubuntu Linux
* Docker
* Kubernetes


**Meriting Knowledge:**
* Artifactory
* Black Duck
* VMware vSphere
* Prometheus
* Grafana
* Loki
* Ansible
* Powershell


**Start Date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Open positions:** 
 1 developer
   

  

**Office Presence:** 
 Mandatory at least 60% in the Täby office.
   

  

 Join us in shaping the future of software development and making remarkable things happen! If you're passionate about DevOps and possess the skills we're looking for, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Chief Technology Officer
description: The CTO is the company's top technology executive and is responsible for establishing the company's technical vision leading all aspects of the company's technology development and future growth.

title: Engagement- Engineering Manager Tech
description:
Betsson Group is now looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
**Tech** 
 within the Engagement Domain
   

  

 The WoW
   

  

 As an Engineering Manager at Betsson Group, your primary responsibilities will be geared towards building and leading high-performing engineering teams, meaning a lot of your focus will be on our most important asset – our people! You will work closely with your product and design counterparts on the planning and scoping of the product development roadmap, where you will be accountable for the engineering teams’ delivery. You will also be expected to take ownership and responsibility for the technical stability and performance of the applications under the tutelage of your teams.
   

  

 A taster of what you will be involved with
   

  

* Build and lead high-performing engineering teams.
* Ensure the engineering teams are properly structured, staffed, and possess the right roles and skills.
* Drive excellence in engineer recruitment, onboarding and career development.
* Foster an engineering culture of ownership, collaboration, and passion for delivering quality products.
* Be an active part of the cross-functional leadership team for the area.
* Collaborate with other engineering leaders across the organisation to share best practices.
* Accountable for the engineering teams’ delivery in terms of both time and quality.
* Work closely with your product counterpart(s) and provide a high level of support for product activities.
* Define team performance metrics to monitor and report on team productivity and individual Team Leads and Engineers performance.
* Drive the continuous optimisation and improvement of team and development processes.
* Take ownership for resolving situations hindering the performance of the teams. Be able to deep dive into solutions, when necessary, track and follow up external dependencies.
* Advocate and advance modern agile software development practices.
* Step into any missing role as and when may be required.


 You are good with
   

  

* Understanding of .NET technology stack and hosting applications both on premises and in cloud, CI/CD and monitoring, messaging within a micro service architecture, automated QA.
* Through collaboration with your architecture and product counterparts, ensure the engineering teams are aware of any strategies, standards and business goals they are expected to follow.
* Making sure priorities are clear and followed.
* Nurturing product knowledge gain, sharing, and documentation standards.
* Nurturing teamwork and collaboration within the domain and with other teams.
* Make sure teams are taking part in building product backlog with clear value for technical initiatives, feature suggestions, improvements, automations etc.
* Driving ownership and awareness of system health, performance and stability.
* Champion technical initiatives for consideration in the product development roadmap.
* Establish a strategy to identify and manage technical debt.
* Ensuring highly effective software development with built-in quality assurance, support and maintenance processes are in place.
* Ensuring SLAs are defined and being actively monitored and followed


 You have experience in
   

  

* Mandatory Hands-on experience in software development, ideally in gaming industry, CRM, payments or similar transactional, highly loaded systems.
* Planning and leading the delivery of product and technical initiatives. Documenting solution designs, agreeing and following up on dependencies.
* Managing engineering teams in terms of employment, professional development, performance evaluation and policies.
* Being responsible and accountable for 2+ engineering teams and directly manage Team Leads.
* Recruitment and hiring of Team Leads and Engineers


 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
   

  

* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
* Freedom with responsibility


 Challenge Accepted?
   

  

 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our tech colleagues are talking about.
   

  

 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Engagement- Head of Engineering
description:
Betsson Group is now looking for a
 **Head of** 
**Engineering** 
 within the Engagement Domain in the Stockholm hub.
   

  

 The WoW
   

  

 As the Head of Engineering (Engagement), you will provide leadership for our engineering teams working on our Engagement product vertical. You will be accountable for the delivery, in terms of both time and quality, of all engineering teams working in the domain. You will work closely with your product counterparts on executing the roadmap, whilst driving technical excellence in terms of code quality, stability, scalability, and security.
   

  

 A taster of what you will be involved with
   

  

* Build and lead a high performing, top class engineering organisation covering multiple teams, setting out proper strategies towards this goal.
* Support, mentor and coach the engineering managers and leads. Collaborate with the architecture team and actively support their direction to drive the technical vision and enable the future state architectural design of the domain.
* Work closely with your product counterparts to develop, support and execute on product roadmaps and towards shared goals. Champion technical initiatives for consideration in the product development roadmap.
* Maintain a deep understanding of the gaming industry, performing competitor analysis, staying up-to-date with trends, emerging technologies.
* Foster a culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and collaboration within the team, promoting best practices in software engineering and agile methodologies.
* Drive the delivery of initiatives across the teams, ensuring that we are maximising the potential of our people and their delivery.
* Ensure the platform's reliability, security, and scalability by proactively addressing potential risks and performance bottlenecks.
* Manage engineering budgets, resources, and timelines effectively, delivering projects on time and within scope.
* Develop and implement metrics and KPIs to monitor platform performance, driving data-driven decision-making and improvements.
* Identify and address technical and process bottlenecks. Set an example in taking responsibility and ownership, which may also mean stepping in to any missing role as and when may be required.


 Main Stakeholders
   

  

* Head of Product, Product Managers & Product Owners
* Architects
* Other Engineering Teams


 You have experience in
   

  

* Building and leading high performing engineering teams, with at least 2 years’ experience in a senior / strategic engineering leadership role.
* A strong background in software engineering, preferably having 10+ years’ experience working in engineering roles.
* Demonstrated experience in nurturing and coaching engineering leaders.
* Passionate about technology and how it can enable business growth and opportunities, in particular in how it satisfies user needs.
* Experience and understanding of agile practices and techniques for developing products.
* Confident working in a complex technical environment with hands-on experience working with highly available and high load transactional systems, with the ability to drive focus on performance, scalability and security.
* Experience in defining OKRs and KPIs, working with data to understand system(s) performance and the outcomes of product development.
* Proven ability to lead analyses and evaluations for complex decisions.
* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus.
* A humble and inspirational leader who leads by example and fosters a culture of ownership and collaboration.
* Strong organisational, planning and project management skills.
* Excellent verbal & written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical topics to non-technical stakeholders.
* Excellent presentation skills, with the ability to present effectively to C-Level.
* Professional working proficiency in English.


 Plus to have
   

  

* Relevant working experience in the gaming industry.
* Experience working with remote / geographically distributed
* Familiarity with AI/ML technologies used in Marketing.
* Experience in working with and managing third-party suppliers.


 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
   

  

* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
* Freedom with responsibility


 Challenge Accepted?
   

  

 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our tech colleagues are talking about.
   

  

 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Team Manager - Online Fraud Prevention
description:
**Job Description**
 To provide a secure, trustworthy, and always available experience to our customers, we are now transforming the way we address the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have created a new Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments. Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a unit that focuses on Cyber Security Engineering, with the mission to protect our customers, colleagues, and company by establishing and managing safe and secure technology use.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead one of our Global Engineering teams, focused on Cyber crime and
 **Online Fraud Prevention** 
 to drive our delivery and services portfolio throughout the whole H&M Group and all our brands. You will report to the Head of Cyber Security Engineering Unit.
   

  

 We are looking for a strong
 **Manage** 
 r and principal leader within B2C Online e-commerce Fraud prevention who can drive our delivery and services portfolio.
   

  

 You will ensure that core capabilities are in place to manage Cybercrime, online Fraud and Loss prevention. You will grow and mature the internal and external organisation, from individual team members to our managed services partners. You will drive risk management work related to the Cybercrime area, improve the security posture to meet current and emerging threats, and proactively work with compliance to policies and regulations. More specifically you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Manage day-to-day activities of the Online Fraud Prevention team, ensuring operational and performance objectives are met.
* Spear-head team-level budgeting, planning, and roadmap initiatives.
* Cultivate professional development within the team to ensure relevant skills and qualifications.
* Navigate stakeholder relationships to align Fraud Prevention with business needs, regulatory requirements, and company policies.
* Contribute to the Cyber Security strategy and ensure team alignment.
* Respond to audit findings, prioritize remediation measures, and manage your team's budget, including staff, contracts, and technology.
* Identify demands, objectives, and key results, defining and monitoring supporting KPIs and metrics.
* Ensure the availability, stability, and performance of Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention services.
* Assess and manage risks to the effectiveness of platforms and services, protecting against current and emerging threats.


**Qualifications**
 We envision you as a seasoned leader with experience in a Leadership role, preferably within retail or e-commerce, deploying modern technologies in large, complex organizations. Key attributes include:
   

  

* Have a background in leading online e-commerce Fraud Prevention teams for B2C, specializing in areas such as payments fraud, chargeback rates reduction, discount abuse, gift card abuse, account takeovers, and e-commerce fraud attacks.
* Creative and critical thinking, offering ideas and solutions to ongoing challenges.
* A track record of successful Cybercrime, Online Fraud, and Loss prevention deliveries in complex global environments.
* Experience in leading a team that designs, implements, and deploys Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention solutions.
* Working hands-on experience in areas such as cybercrime, online fraud, loss prevention, cyber forensics investigations, or proactive pattern recognitions.
* End-to-end project delivery experience with hands-on involvement in product development for Cybercrime and online Fraud prevention.
* Experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Leadership understanding of team dynamics and staff personal development.
* Beneficial certifications: CISSP, CISM, CompTia Security+, Identity Management Institute (IMI) certifications.


 Above all, we value your passion, pride in achievements, and the ability to share this enthusiasm with your colleagues.
   

  

**Benefits**
**Additional Information**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Senior IT Service Manager
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Som Service Manager inom IT-domänen Commerce kommer du att spela en central roll i att förvalta system som optimerar arbetsprocesserna och förbättrar kundupplevelsen över alla försäljningskanaler. Detta inkluderar system som POS och vår ehandelsplattform. Du kommer att vara systemägare för dessa kritiska system och arbeta nära våra leverantörer för att säkerställa att de lever upp till våra krav, samt följa upp incidenter och rotorsaksanalyser. Vidare kommer du att hantera systemleveranser, inklusive förändringshantering och informationsspridning, både internt och externt. Du kommer också att vara delaktig i avtalsprocesser, samt stötta budgetarbetet och säkerställa att beslutade aktiviteter genomförs. I uppstarten kommer du ha en nyckelroll i att bygga upp arbetet med drift och förvaltning av POS.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
 Vi söker dig som har mer än 5 års erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter, antingen i en linjebefattning eller som konsult. Du har också en högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande med relevant inriktning.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Att arbeta med IT-processer enligt ITIL, särskilt Incident Management, Problem Management och Root Cause Analysis.
* Avtalsarbete och uppföljning av SLA.
* Större systemleverantörer för POS, ehandel
* Att arbeta med internationella aktörer och översätta deras lösningar till kundens dagliga behov.
* Molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* Applikationsdrift och bred IT-kunskap.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 06-11-2024
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, AI, Machine Learning, Test, Cloud, Infra DevOps, , IT-Projektledning.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

description:
